t: Psalm 51
Create in Me a Clean Heart, O God
To the choirmaster. A Psalm of David, when Nathan the prophet went to him, after he had gone in to Bathsheba.
Have*pn mercy on me, O God, according*ld to your steadfast love; according*ln to your abundant mercy blot*ld out my transgressions.
Wash*ln me thoroughly from my iniquity, and*ld cleanse me from my sin!
For*pn I know my transgressions, and*ld my sin is ever before me.
Against*ln you, you only, have I sinned and*ld done what is evil in your sight, so*ln that you may be justified in your words and*ld blameless in your judgment.
Behold,*ln I was brought forth in iniquity, and*ld in sin did my mother conceive me.
Behold,*ln you delight in truth in the inward being, and*ld you teach me wisdom in the secret heart.
Purge*pn me with hyssop, and I shall be clean; wash*ld me, and I shall be whiter than snow.
Let*ln me hear joy and gladness; let*ld the bones that you have broken rejoice.
Hide*ln your face from my sins, and*ld blot out all my iniquities.
Create*ln in me a clean heart, O God, and*ld renew a right spirit within me.
Cast*ln me not away from your presence, and*ld take not your Holy Spirit from me.
Restore*ln to me the joy of your salvation, and*ld uphold me with a willing spirit.
Then*pn I will teach transgressors your ways, and*ld sinners will return to you.
Deliver*ln me from bloodguiltiness, O God, O*ld God of my salvation, and*ld my tongue will sing aloud of your righteousness.
O*ln Lord, open my lips, and*ld my mouth will declare your praise.
For*ln you will not delight in sacrifice, or I would give it; you*ld will not be pleased with a burnt offering.
The*ln sacrifices of God are a broken spirit; a*ld broken and contrite heart, O God, you will not despise.
Do*pn good to Zion in your good pleasure; build*ld up the walls of Jerusalem;
then*ln will you delight in right sacrifices, in*ld burnt offerings and whole burnt offerings; then*ld bulls will be offered on your altar.
